9009c91fb1a8d7da9538e59c47764be0 (14:59): I'm having a problem compiling PHP I get "configure: error: Cannot find OpenSSL's <evp.h>" and that file is present in /usr/include/openssl and /usr/include/ssl I tried compiling with "--with-imap --with-imap-ssl=/usr/include/openssl", "--with-imap --with-imap-ssl", "--with-imap --with-imap-ssl --with-openssl-dir=/usr/include/openssl/", "--with-imap --with-imap-ssl=/usr/include/ssl" (I'm on Suse 10 / amd64)

b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:02): thyko: Although if the file is 200MB, you're probably going to have to adjust your memory limit

b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:06): retro_neo: Well, "/usr/include/openssl" will never be the correct value
bfa37a9dc3d7e776692d2e4ee917f6d0 (15:06): TML: I had too many problems on compiling PHP modules on 64-bit machine... I usually had to hack the configure file at the end...
364a233793fc1d2039ce3b56e5b04fdd (15:06): TML: is there a way to compress the file directly without copying it to a variable first?
b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:06): retro_neo: Because it would look for something along the lines of: /usr/include/openssl/include/openssl
b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:07): thyko: Not without using something like exec(), no.

b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:12): Stormchaser: What do you mean "PHP can't look into */lib64"? Admittedly, I've only had limited exposure to 64 bit environments, but the OS linker should abstract that. PHP doesn't hardcode that sort of thing.

b4a2591f4dec919fa3954523bf35a8c9 (15:15): Stormchaser: Hmmm...do you remember an extension? Because configure shouldn't have /lib *OR* /usr/lib. That's supposed to be provided by your toolchain...e.g., autoconf, etc.
